comment: Gauss' Lemma (see also theorem 9.6 in [ApostolNT] p. 182) for integer ` 2 ` : Let p be an odd prime. Let S={2,4,6,...,(p-1)}. Let n denote the number of elements of S whose least positive residue modulo p is greater than p/2. Then ( 2 | p ) = (-1)^n. (Contributed by AV, 14-Jul-2021.)
